definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

pinyin: ming2 yu4 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

sentences.english: In 1991, Guinness received an Honorary Doctorate from Cambridge University.
sentences.chinese: 1991年吉尼斯獲得劍橋大學名譽博士學位。

sentences.english: The institution recently gave the president an honorary doctorate.
sentences.chinese: 該學院不久前授予了布什名譽博士學位。

sentences.english: I am deeply honoured to receive this honorary doctorate from Hebrew University today.
sentences.chinese: 今天獲得希伯來大學頒發名譽博士學位，我深感榮幸。

sentences.english: He received an honorary doctorate degree in Humane Letters.
sentences.chinese: 他剛獲得了人文主義文學名譽博士學位。
